The Roses Soundtrack

02/05/2021

Kristina Wemyss and Alex Thompson take a look at some of the best music from Yorkshire and Lancashire in anticipation of Roses Unlocked.

Image by Alex Thompson

By Kristina Wemyss

Roses Are White: Alex Thompson

When the Arctic Monkeys first exploded onto the scene in 2006 with their electrifying debut Whatever People Say I Am Thatâ€™s What Iâ€™m Not, it was most of our generations first taste of what Yorkshire had to offer to the music scene. With the worldwide success of the Sheffield lads, itâ€™s easy to forget that Yorkshire has a lot more to offer than the Monkeyâ€™s discography.

It wouldnâ€™t be a Yorkshire playlist without some classic indie, and we have this in an abundance. Kicking off with the ripping chords of Arctic Monkeys â€˜I Bet You Look Good On The Dancefloor', a track so iconically Yorkshire and something that will get everyone up on their feet and moving (even if it is in their living room). I cannot say enough nice things about this album so please go give it a spin.

Roses Are Red: Kristina Wemyss

The red rose county certainly does have some fantastic artists to brag about. Hopefully, this yearâ€™s Roses will provide a welcome light at the end of the tunnel and give us a taste of what we have to look forward to in post-pandemic times.

Admittedly, far more iconic musicians have come out of Yorkshire, and no, we arenâ€™t making that up. Overall, the red roses have a fantastic selection of songs, but our own editors think that Yorkshire-bred talent takes the top spot here.
